alert.note: Alert for District of Columbia (District of Columbia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Watch issued May 07 at 3:24PM EDT until May 09 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...One to one and half feet of inundation above ground level possible in low lying areas due to tidal flooding. * WHERE...Shoreline in the District of Columbia. * WHEN...From late Sunday night through Monday afternoon, especially around the time of high tide. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads may be closed. Low lying property including homes, businesses, and some critical infrastructure may be inundated. Some shoreline erosion may occur. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Tides one to one and a half feet above normal. The next two high tides at Washington Channel are at 2:04 AM and 1:58 PM.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
